name: Dasha Tuzova
text: Super easy to use and very practical. I love wine and I love GOOD wine but I'm new in this business and so like to experience different types. If you want to experiment a bit or just do a quick search of the wines you're contemplating about, this is the app! Also it has a lot of useful features like sales and 'wine news'

name: Paul de Cort
text: Overall I like the app. However one niggle relates to adding the location where I purchased the wine. Why can I not specify a location for the wine I purchase, without allowing access to my current location? I don't usually add wines to my list at the supermarket when I buy the wines... so the location at at when I drink them is irrelevant to where I purchased the wines. Please allow of to search and add locations without the need for the app to know my current location. Thanks!

name: Finn
text: It's quite simply a really useful app to keep track of the wines you've drunk, and though this log and the ratings you give the wines, it'll recommend you other wines in various price groups. It'll also build a taste Profile for you based on the wines you drink and like from various regions. It's a really nice app

name: Helenia Pan
text: I use this app mostly when I randomly browsing the wine section of grocery stores and wine shops. Take a picture of the bottle, and you can see the price and reviews. Really helpful when you must get a bottle in a hurry.

name: Bob Junk
text: Great app to get good views on new wines. Great app to determine relative cost for a wine I am considering. Also a good app to provide recommendations for wines similar to the wines I like. VIVINO is one of my favorite apps and everyone I have recommended it to has thanked me.

name: John Bretz
text: Great little App. Gives us non wine snobs the ability to learn about wines, as well as know if it's a good one or not, and worth what you're paying.

name: James Johnson
text: Easy to use and very informative. Makes it easy to keep track of my inventory and helps improve the quality of my choices.

name: Tim Roberts
text: So glad I was introduced to this. I know nothing of wine and every time I'm tasked with buying a bottle it tastes horrid to me. My friend told me about this app, and the take a photo to check rating feature. Now I'm buying bottles around 3.6 stars and above and around £8 mark. People are really happy with the wines and I'm even able to drink them. Absolutely the best app find of the year for me.

name: Thomas Luczywo
text: Really nicely done wine app. Very impressive. Awesome for inventory, as well as learning wines.

name: Kayla Gale
text: This app is great. I don't buy a wine without consulting it, and it's a great way to remember the different ones you've tried and check out prices. The user interface is really intuitive, but I haven't used all the features yet, just the searching-by-pictute feature, (which has never failed me).

name: M Whitmore
text: On the one hand, a great app. On other it crashes all the time on my S7.
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Niall Stembrowicz
text: Great Experience. Really easy to use, a great community along with pretty accurate information.

name: Nancy Lindquist
text: I like the app. Yes, it's goal is to sell wine, but you can store your bottles and rate them. Far better than the spreadsheet I was using and portable for restaurants.

name: riani wahyu prajanti
text: The app is really easy to use. Lots of information about wines and especially the reviews help me in buying wines. Not all the time though, sometimes i bought wines with 3.3 or 3.5 review but those taste quite good! I would really like it if there is a feature to share the wine cellars. My boyfriend has scanned all of the wines we have and added those to his cellar list and i can't have the list on my account, too bad!

name: Kamal Husain
text: Awesome. The way it can scan a label and find the wine uses the best tech. The features to keep track of your wines, similar ones and where to buy helps so much. With so many wines out there, remembering what you had is not easy. This is the tool for you if you like wine.

name: Michael B
text: Excellent app! Great for scanning wines for reviews and rating prior to purchasing. The cellar option is great for inventory of wines. Made 5 purchases from different Vivino merchants, got some great buys and good service!

name: Greg Piesco
text: Great app. Makes finding and remembering your favorite wines easy!

name: Nikola Dimitrijević
text: I am so gratefull for your hard work on this app. There is a lot of room for improvements but nevertheless I would give you 6 stars if I could. As being the Software Product Manager myself, I am more than well aware of the hard and diligent work involved in this kind of app Once again thanks! Edit December, 2019: there is a serious flaw in application that directly affects the user data, as removing the data from My wines, will remove user reviews and cellar data as well, without any warning
vivino_response: Thank you for the kind feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Christine Hearn
text: I love trying a new wine at a restaurant, then scanning it to the Vivino app to find out where I can buy it locally and how much the retail price is! Also love their recommendations based on my scans!

name: Mike Stengel
text: I love this for being able to keep up with the wines I buy. This app let's me rate them so I can remember which ones I've had. It also makes suggestions for other wines too.

name: Danny Granville
text: lots of spam immediately after signing up with non sense recommendations. app runs in background just in case you spend all day drinking different wines. i liked the concept of this app, but it is way over the top for anyone just looking for wine occassionally. uninstall.

name: Dan Villa
text: This app is great basically I use it all the time to track my wines. But there's a big big flaw, you cannot scan the back label of the bottle. For wine connoisseurs this is the most important label.

name: Teodor Tabirca
text: Fantastic wine database, reviews and possibilities.

text: A good starting point. Many of ratings are for the wrong vintage. The five point rating system is not nuanced enough, should be ten points.

text: Very convenient and informative. I like the trivia and wine quizzes as well as the simplicity of the app to tell me what wine I am looking at at the store or resturant.

text: Before I buy any wine nowadays, especially when I am abroad, I always review any potential wine purchase with a quick check by Vivino. I have been able to purchase some amazing wines from various European and South American countries that are not of the large commercial variety and are not well known in North America. 👍👍

text: Great tool for choosing wine. Really helpful for discovering new wines, saved me a lot of money and kept me away from bad choices.

text: This app is intuitive and easy to use. Notification options make this a worthy addition to wannabe wine conoisseurs. A welcome tool to discern wine options!

name: Robert Wilken
text: A nice way to research wines and values.

name: Matthew Scott
text: It's a great app and works very well, unfortunately Vivino does not care how wine is shipped. I ordered 2 bottles of Bertani Amarone 2008 and received them scorching hot. My girlfriend and I knew right away that the wine had been cooked during delivery... Both bottles of my Amarone were ruined... I will not be buying through Vivino again, but will still use the app to search for and identify wine.
vivino_response: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear you had a bad experience with buying wines through Vivino. Please feel free to contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or on support@vivino.com with a description of your experience, and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.

text: Excellent - except for location/price feature. This is a fabulous app in general, which allows you to keep track of wine you have bought & decide what's best in a supermarket etc. But the location feature is ridiculous, listing every tiny alcohol free cafe near you, making it impossible to record that you bought a bottle for £x at a wine shop or supermarket a couple of miles away. If you turn location off you can't say where you purchased, it just tells you to turn location on. Please correct!

name: Rhonda Scurek
text: Love it. Great way to save my favorites wines.

name: Diego Zingano
text: great app! It helped me to select wines when travelling to other countries. The reviews from other friends also were great to get to know much more about wines.

name: Tim Ruskell
text: Easy to navigate

name: Donnie Mann
text: Latest update has fixed problem when rating wines (used to be a red bar along top of screen covering the stars ). App is a great way to find new wines, help choose wines, and gauge how ridiculously overpriced restaurant wines are! I'm not a huge wine drinker, but it's useful to see my tastes categorised and it helps build a picture of personal preferences.
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Nathan Lawton
text: app is terrific for cataloguing wines and tracking tastes. also great if you want to practice writing reviews and develop your pallate further. recently though, the camera part has become more and more buggy. if i want to add a wine, i usually have to restart the app two or three times before it works. the other downside is that since the photo thing is not perfect, a lot of people write reviews under the wrong wine. edit: the camera feature has now even caused my phone to crash once or twice.
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Danielle Tardif
text: Great app for wine aficionados I have been using this free app for over 3 years and I absolutely love it. It's very easy to use. Just take a photo of the label and the wine info is uploaded automatically. It's great for logging wines and adding my personal notes. I can then easily search my database when I'm shopping or at restaurants. It can also be used for searching wines that I have not yet tasted. I highly recommend this app.

name: Володимир Гусар
text: Very useful for true vinelovers

name: Alan Le Map
text: yes. works. after many years of evolution its amazing the label recognition it has and the catalt is complete except when I add an really obscure off the grid wine. integrates price and ratings by vintage and even the buy feature. i use it to make choices all the time and perhaps the most stunning feature for avoiding oainful wine buying mistakes is ability to scan a wine list in a restaurant (and see price performance ratio).

name: ELCTM
text: EDIT: both the app and the support page are back to normal so while it would have been great to have some warning, putting this to 5 stars as the App is great This is genuinely my favorite app but has completely stopped working for my wife and I for last few days - cannot log in whatsoever. Website has SSL certificate issue so we can't even get onto support pages to check if there is a known issue!
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Aileen RA Dualan
text: improvements are helpful, e.g. feed on what friends are up to. would be nice to allow tagging option. updated review Feb 2019 The most recent update has been causing the app to crash. Also new ratings are not uploading properly. and also a few times trying to make corrections to entries and there is no feedback. I think the developers have to learn to harness and close the feedback loop.
vivino_response: Thank you for your feedback. We’re sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support? We really want to solve any issues you might experience. Looking forward to hearing from you.

name: Tony Bricknell
text: Can't fully disable push notifications. App settings has a full section for controlling push notifications. However, even with every option set to disabled, I still get the occasional push notification. Though this may be a great app, I can't abide push notifications. Fix this, and the rating goes up. Until then, I'm uninstalling.
vivino_response: Thanks for the feedback. We’re sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support, so we can address the issue? We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Jacobus Mostert
text: Best wine rating and wine exploration app. I have learned so much about wine, because of this app. I get to share my own experiences and ratings, see what other wine experts say about wines, help others find great wine and make great buying decisions when purchasing wine. It is really simple and easy to use. When you delve further, there are really cool features and functions hidden in the app. Another cool thing is that you don't get punished for making an ignorant edit. You learn with time!

name: Paul Boucher
text: Its that kind of app that you start using forever. Well made app. gives approx price, region. ranking in the world, logs your tasted wines and all. solid well done and good looking app. love it!

name: Deborah Brown
text: I've enjoyed this app immensely. I travel extensively and find myself before various bottles of wine, sometimes I'll taste something enjoyable and decide to bring it home to the states. I use the app to photograph the bottle samples or used it in a store to help me decide which bottle to pick out!

name: Dániel Elszászer
text: It seems to be a nice app, I'm curious how useful will it be on the long run. After the first use it seems that the review system could be improved eg. wset has quite good rating/tasting system which I'd consider to implement. The second one is that as a Hungarian I could not notice that our wine regions are not getting that much space among the styles... please work on it, it worth the effort, so people actually will get to know more about Tokaj, Somló, Badacsony, Villany. We have some specialties which would deserve the spotlight, it's enough to mention Aszú from Tokaj which is a huge competition for Sauternes...
vivino_response: Thank you for your feedback. We would love if you could contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or support@vivino.com with your ideas and feedback on how we can improve the app so we can direct it to our developers. Looking forward to hear from you.

name: Chuck Payne
text: This app is nice for exploring new wines without tasting. Simply pull up the app, scan the label, wait a few seconds and information about the wine pops up. Wine makers note are available, and wine paring suggestions. Also suggestion about other wines in this category. Very useful app.

name: Sierra S.
text: Super convenient way to keep track of wines I like and don't like. I've used the app at the store to make sure I don't accidentally buy a wine I already tried and didn't enjoy. Finding the wine by a photo of the label is another great feature of this app and easier than typing it in.

name: Gillian Jones
text: I don't always give a 5 star rating, I always leave room for improvement but this is the best app! Totally amazed by the research it is efficient and accurate. I recommend this app 100% it is really informative for persons who has that special interest in wines. Again, LOVE IT!

name: David Awanda
text: Awesome app. It's a great place for wine lovers

name: bsilviu2000
text: Great app for a "beginner"

name: Janna Johnstone
text: This is a very useful app. Helps when users leave detailed reviews. I find the ratings are usually pretty close to my experience with wines when I buy them based on this app. I usually pay the most attention to the 4-5* and 1* reviews because knowing why people hated a wine sometimes helps more than positive reviews.

name: Candice Gilliam
text: Great app! Has helped me find new wines, store the wines I have in my "cellar" and learn more about wine in general. I use it all the time when buying wine at the store. Just wish I could share the "cellar" feature so that my boyfriend and I could both maintain it.

name: Paul Maconochie
text: The app works well. It has recognised most of the current release wines that I have entered. The app is less informative on wines that I may have kept for a few years. Comments by others on the wines that I drink are helpful in developing insight into what other people may smell and taste in the same wine.

name: Ramon Navarro
text: Excellent app for Wine Lover and Enthuiast!

name: Patrick Bouvry
text: VivinoMarch 6, 2019
vivino_response: We’re sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support? We really want to solve any issues you might experience. Looking forward to hearing from you.

name: John Green
text: this is an awesome app that has helped me to select wide range of excellent wines. just a suggestion that if users can filter by number of people rated the wine will be great. for example, same 4 star rated wines one only has 100 people rated whereas another one may have been rated by 2000 people. i would definitely pick the later one.

name: Ceal Webber
text: I use and rely on vivino to find great wines, keep track of my cellar, and follow friends and other wine enthusiast. love it

name: Maryna Dymovich
text: I have been using this app to track the wines I enjoy since 2005. I also check others' opinions on a wine before buying it. I think it's a fantastic app, simple to use, with some info on grape varieties and valuable opinions from the vivino community. I like how it highlights your preferences and shows whether a wine is bold, dry, has cherry notes, etc. It's very useful if you are a wine lover.

name: Roxanne Clément
text: Great app, would definitely recommend. As a suggestion, a feature the developers should think about implementing would be the addition of a 'would buy again' to the ratings/reviews. Just something to think about.

name: Austin Hazelrig
text: app tries to do to much and makes it unusable. Try to rate a wine; it is makes the stars flash but ignores user input. That is if you can see the stars. The done button to back out of the rating area often covers the stars needed to rate making rating impossible
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. text: VivinoAugust 5, 2019

We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: A Google user
text: Great app, helps with rough price comparison, and tasting. Great to keep track of your favorite wines.

name: Luc Vande Velde
text: Always useful and interesting

name: Vladimir Shapkin
text: Very helpful app

name: Gary Crispens
text: This is an excellent app as it recognizes the wine labels and brings up your personal reviews as well as other people's reviews in most recent date order. This is handy when shopping for wines so you can scan labels and remember what you like.

name: Michael Lloyd III
text: Great wine app for tracking and finding varietals. Highly recommended to my friends. The ability to do some research and see others thoughts on bottle before purchase cant be understated. Also helps you find similar wines close to your palate. 5/5 stars.

name: Ewald Van Der Helm
text: Great tool for getting info about many wines even rare ones. allows keeping track of your cellar. You can add your ones wines. some adds but still acceptable. tool quotes prices in your country of residence rather than of the country where you are currently.

name: Wanda Brann
text: Love this app! It's great for someone who loves wine but doesn't know a lot about wines. It's so easy. Go to the store, scan a label, and it tells you what it's rated by other wine drinkers and what it should average retail cost. So you know if your getting a good wine and if you're overpaying.

name: Andy DL
text: Have been trying to download for 2 days but it keeps saying "Waiting for download"...
vivino_response: We’re sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support or email support@vivino.com? We really want to solve any issues you might experience. Looking forward to hearing from you.

name: Ardian Kelmendi
text: amazing app amd very easy to use. very accurate and provides a ton of useful information on the wine.. how the taste, smoothness and few more categories bout the wine.. also what that wine pairs with.. just an amazing app to have esp if you have a restaurant buisness like i do. awesome job guys..

name: Eamonn Maguire
text: It's really a great app. Works super well, good suggestions, and I'm addicted to scanning wines in the supermarket now (not sure if that's a good thing :)). But we've really found some great wines using this app that we probably wouldn't have bought otherwise.

name: Thabo Hermanus
text: This app has evolved and is now more of a reliable almanac for me on the wines I taste, what I thought of it when I tasted it versus what I think of the same vintage of the wine many years later. That it is quite an engaging community who give you ideas of what they tried and what they liked makes it an awesome tool to search and find new wines to try. If you are not that overboard in what you want, it's a great app to have some idea about a bottle of wine before you and what the opinions are 🤓

name: Mark Kennedy
text: Couldn't get the app to work. When creating a profile you must select your country, but when i do i get and error and can't proceed.
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: L. Derek Hardy
text: To many useless "message" popups in my notifications trying to sell stuff. Not worth it.
vivino_response: We’re sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support? We really want to solve any issues you might experience. Looking forward to hearing from you.

name: James Pilachowski
text: Great app overall. Tons of information about wine in general and robust marketplace. Also a helpful cellar feature. The folks in the vivino community are super nice. No snob or troll factor from what I can see. I deleted Facebook a long time ago and still enjoy Vivino. Cheers!

name: Suzanne Lee
text: I've had the app for a while and mostly use it to remember what wines I want to purchase again or for recommendations. I really enjoy being able to see my notes over time and comments from more experienced tasters. the only thing I wish it would add would be some guided tasting notes on less common varietals.

name: Hugo Rochefort
text: Super user friendly app, cool features, non intrusive ads (they recommended wines and that's totally fine, I don't mind having sponsored content if it's nicely done like with this app). The wine recognition is very quick and the rating system with the average price is super useful. Good job the dev team!

name: Victor
text: Vivino is one of the best app. Drink wine is good but with Vivino we can enjoy and learn more about wine. It is simple and easy. Cheers!!!

name: Suzie Vargo
text: Love this app. Just take a pic of the wine bottle and reviews will pop up. Much better than guessing!

name: Steven M
text: Great App, though I don't always agree with the average ratings. I recommend this app to everyone and anyone however. Usually mention it to random people standing next to me in the shop looking at wine.

name: Lyndon Rumpel
text: Pretty nice app! But I'm quite puzzled why the map feature hasn't been fixed, it's quite embarrassing! I've gotten false locations on the winery origin forever, e.g. for Tuscany, Italy I get some point on the Normandy coast of France?!

name: Joseph Copeland
text: Great app. I live in Germany and travel for work around Europe fairly frequently. Vivino allows me to learn about new, unfamiliar wines and track my ratings for 100s of wines in so many different places. Not sure if it works in the US, but in Germany I'm able to order my favorite wines from the various countries through the app to be delivered to my home. Perfect app for travel.

name: James Malm
text: Love this app. It's fun comparing wines and seeing what they are rated. And I love that the ratings are generated by the wine drinkers and not the wine companies. And I must say the rateings are accurate.

name: Uma k.
text: very useful. for people like me who are in a hurry to buy good wine appropriate to the occasion or food, this app has been more than reliable. i have never gone wrong since i started using this app...and i don't have to depend on the knowledge of the store keeper for his suggestion any more 😃😃

name: Brian Nasralla
text: It's great just make sure it captures the correct year. Some of the labels have the year on the side or back and if the label didn't change from year to year Vivino will not always get the year correct. when it shows the rating of the wine you can edit it to change the year.

name: Winter pants
text: after taking a picture and launching the page for that wine, the app then comes up with a black screen and freezes if you press your back button. This means relaunching the app for every wine u check. Don't really want to do that every time so stopped using app for now
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Kimball Allen
text: It's the coolest and best wine app ever. I thought I lost all my wine when I changed phones. But contacted the company and they explained what I needed to do. They responded really quick. But most of all, I enjoy all the information that's listed about the wine's. How it shows me the regions I've drank from and kinds of wine. Plus how much the wine prices are. And it's awesome how it list the popular wine from your current area. i recommend this app to everyone that drinks wine.

name: Astrid Espinoza
text: I love this app! To all of you out there struggling to pick the best wine for whatever ocassion: use this. I really appreciate all the reviews and the information you get by simply scanning a bottle. It's been so helpful! Thanks devs, QAs, POs, everyone back there making this app the awesome thing it is.

name: Charlie Craig
text: VivinoSeptember 12, 2019
vivino_response: We’re sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support? We really want to solve any issues you might experience. Looking forward to hearing from you.

name: Bradley Heisler
text: The best wine research, comparison, and tracking app out there. It has a large community of diverse users, so the ratings are very detailed and comprehensive. I use it multiple times per week.

name: Fred Heaume
text: Wonderful app. Would be nice to be able to make personal (public and private) lists

name: Jagdish Tiwari
text: VivinoNovember 13, 2019
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Alicia Koledin
text: great way to track wines you drink and like. this is the best app I've found so far for this purpose. super easy...all you have to do is take a photo of the label and taste/ provide comments. I haven't found a wine yet that it hasn't recognized.

name: Geoff Hainebach
text: A category of wines priced below R100 would be good. Some of them are better than the more expensive wines

name: Chris Sanders
text: A bit like TheLibraryThing is for books and books you want to know more about, this is a site for wine buffs or wannabe wine buffs. It's amusing to covertly scan someone else's bottle and then casually relate all you know about it after reading the apps review.
vivino_response: Thank you for the great feedback! We hope you continue to enjoy using Vivino.

name: Andrew Galvin
text: awesome wine app. really enjoy being able to see ratings and prices of wines. i would love if they added wine critic scores and allowed for quarter star scores like 4.25/4.75 etc.

name: Amer Hanna
text: Just great wine app

name: Mikhail Gavrikov
text: Great app! Always helpfull and nice to use. The only thing missing at the moment is filtering top lists by wine types. At least by red and white. Would really appreciate if it will be added in the following updates!

name: Amanda Navine
text: Great way to keep track of the wines I have tried. The app is simple and easy to use. While I don't buy wine off the app, I like that I can organize wines I have had so I can repurchased the best if them.

name: Rodney Lang
text: Love reading the reviews before buying the wine

name: Melanie Neely
text: I just got this app, but it seems like it'll be helpful when checking out or choosing a wine! I picked up a REALLY cheap wine today that seems to be good (for what I paid for it).

name: Paul Pattra
text: Overall I love this app, the only one minor issue is that when I sometimes scan a bottle clearly marked as, say a Sauvignon Blanc, Vivino tells me it's a Chardonnay or a Rosé. Apart from that, fantastic service

name: Alessandro De Simone
text: App was working wonderfully until recently when It *forced* me to update to the new version. I did that and now it lags during severals seconds when opening after a while. So basically it lags when I need to quickly open the app for a quick scan. What a pitty
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Thomas Dall
text: My goto app for keeping track of the wine I taste. Does it well and is easy to use. Only issue is the other users rankings... any cheap god-awful wine will get top ratings if it says "France" somewhere on the label. So I don't use the rating system, except as a log for my own use.

name: Paresh Pankhania
text: Great app helping in choosing wine

name: Rudolph Patush
text: Informative and fun!

name: A Google user
text: VivinoNovember 7, 2018
vivino_response: Thank you for the feedback. We're sorry to hear that the app is not working as intended. We would really appreciate if you can contact us through the app or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support with a description of the problems you are facing. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Gavin Schreiber
text: overall, great app. It would be great if you could also invite friends to follow you, as current experience is very one sided and requires a lot of leg work by the user.

name: Matt Corbett
text: This is a great app and so easy to use. provides really useful information on wine. useful ratings, reviews and prices. An easy way to catalogue your wine so you can remember what wines you like/don't like. get on it!

name: Marc McDill
text: Half the time the app doesn't get the wine variety/year, etc. right. Furthermore, it can be hard to correct the data ehen it is wrong. Seems like the app creators are more interested in selling wine than helping me understand and enjoy the eine more.
vivino_response: Thanks for the feedback. We are continually working to make sure our data is correct. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or on support@vivino.com, so we can address the issue?

name: Sam Batties
text: App is very useful when reviewing a new wine list at a restaurant.. Rating scales provide some guidance for selection.. Also I have used the cellar feature to track the contents of one of my wine racks. would like to see some added functions added like price, date, and location purchased by bottle

name: jack spaulding
text: I like it. it helps me all the time at the store and at home (wine club collection). I like being able to keep my dufas reviews private with friends only. I also like reading the ultra descriptive reviews to see if i can taste anything they describe.

name: Hakeem Gill
text: Have recommended this app to a lot of my friends and everyone loves it. The ratings and prices are on point. The info makes it so easy to chose the right wine.

name: John Tanzer
text: Genuinely useful and informative. There are two aspects of value. First, an idea of what you are drinking or considering buying. Second, an aide memoire as to what you have imbibed. It is deservedly popular.

name: Sebastian Thomas
text: Been using this app happily for ages, one day all my wines are gone, I'm logged out, can't log in, no way to create a new account and no response from help form. Very annoying.
vivino_response: We’re very sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us again through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support? We really want to solve the issues you are experiencing. Looking forward to hearing from you.

name: Sara KillaCurvz
text: Love the app, stellar for tracking wine and being able to add wines not on the app.

name: Jim L
text: Great for tracking what you've tried, and new stuff. Also a very good resource for shopping. All in all, quite happy with this app.

name: Anthony Hocking
text: Great app. Biggest thing its missing is the wine makers ideal drinking date range. Only has option for consumer to enter it. Would be great if I could catalogue my collection then get reports on whats due before it's past its best.

name: Aikaterini Manaka
text: Occasionally issues with wines not being uploaded, some even lost from wine history. The wine world is huge, but more wines should be registered while at he same time recognized as regional styles if applicable. Needs more effort.
vivino_response: We’re sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support? We really want to solve any issues you might experience. Looking forward to hearing from you.

name: Lulu, Drinker of Coffee
text: Helps me remember what wines I liked and avoid buying ones I dont like again

name: Olga Elman
text: love the app! it works very well for all occassions: evaluating a single bottle or choosing one from multitudes on the shelf or choosing one off a restaurant menu. also keeps my info/library of wines i drank and enjoyed. very very handy!

name: Rebecca Rader
text: I never write reviews but this app has been invaluable to me in my job as an adult beverage specialist/manager. Finally, an easy way to track everything I taste and learn combined with all the information I need about any given wine, instantly.

name: Danielle O'Grady
text: One of my favorite apps ever! So informative, so enjoyable, and it always makes me happy! I have never had one technical issue with this app. It's wonderful!

name: KV
text: Absolutely great for chosing not only the right regional style, but also the right vintage. Always use it when I want to explore something new.

name: A Google user
text: I really like the app for tracking what is in my cellar and for researching wines before I buy. I take a quick photo in the wine store and have ratings in just a few seconds.

name: Jill Stostad
text: This app provides very helpful recommendations from real wine lovers when wine shopping. Photograph or search the wine and see detailed comments and review from the people who purchase and enjoy that specific type of wine. Before Vivino I just had the word of store guys who prefer white wine or beer when trying to purchase a good Cabernet. No more surfing the web for reviews in grocery store....its a quick easy route to find intelligent thoughtful taste profile reviews on Vivino.

name: Charlie Crittenden
text: Great way to find out about where wines come from and their cost.

name: Lea Shaw
text: I have been using this app for over two years now and absolutely love it. The reviews and categories are extremely useful when selecting and enjoying a new wine. Cheers!

name: Andrew Ross
text: fantastic wine app, use it to keep my cellar in order, use the notes feature to store the location, makes it much easier to choose and locate a wine for an evening.

name: A Google user
text: The prices are way off. Got a bottle for $15 at a very fancy wine shop and the app valued it at $40 in average. Otherwise really convenient and useful in terms of reviews of other people - helps a lot.

name: Amber M. Keating
text: I love Vivino!!! This app makes it so much easier to keep track of my fave wines. It also makes it super easy to pick wines out at the store. If I don't see a wine I recognize, I check it on Vivini before deciding whether to buy.

name: Meredith C
text: The app quit working. I tried restarting my device and uninstalling then reinstalling the app. I just get an error that says "vivino has stopped" every time I try to open it.
vivino_response: Hello Meredith, I'm sorry you've experienced this problem with the app, which is unfortunately due to a new change we introduced in the latest version. We've fixed the issue now, so the app should work fine now. If you're still experiencing problems with the app, please do not hesitate to contact me via email: oleg@vivino.com Sorry once again, Oleg

name: Maximiliano Barros
text: love it! a lot of wines need more ratings to be usefull... but there are so many different wine companies and different wines that it is understandable.

name: mine dilan özsökmenler
text: Easy to navigate app, gives you local currency prices, you can add other peoples recommendations to your lists. Quick on latest version of android, on a low range phone.

name: James Brown
text: convenient and easy, this little app helps me remember the wines I enjoyed and the ones and did not enjoy. I like being able to make notes and indicate the flavor profile.

name: Jeremiah Watkins
text: Very useful app. Quickly finds the wine you scan and it's right almost every time. The "My Cellar" option is also really handy to track wines you own.

name: Roger Hannah
text: The app works brilliantly, but the reviewers are largely morons. They score Roscato higher than a 95pt Brunello. The app is great for keeping track of your cellar, but for recommendations, it's suitable only for people seeking kool-aid with vodka in it.
vivino_response: Vivino is a platform for wine lovers at all levels, from beginner to expert, where they can share opinions about wine. We have Featured Users who are selected and recognized by Vivino because they share high-quality wine reviews with the Vivino community. If you are looking for highly informed reviews, check out Featured Users reviews.

name: Praveen Sharma
text: Excellent App. Full of information and even if some information is not available then they find it for you and provide within short period of time. 👌

name: Sabine Leunens
text: Fantastic, this app allows me to choose the correct wine regarding my condition. I have an intolerence to fruit nuts (peaches, plums, cherry ...). I get migraines. I love the comments of the wine maker.

name: Tim O'Malley
text: Love this app. I use it when I'm at the wine store to get immediate, reliable reviews. Fun to keep a wine catelog as well. Not a super intuitive app, but gets the job done.

name: Marc Henly
text: Great way to experience new wines and to check prices. Also great when you want to remember that wine you have when you are out for dinner.

name: Bryan
text: impossible to turn off notifications, after every time you togle a notification off it goes back to the top of the list and you have to remember where you were before

vivino_response: The ratings on Vivino is based on the average rating and how often the wine has been rated. More ratings create a more reliable average rating. Therefore you can see a wine that has an average rating of 3.7 being ranked higher than a wine that has an average rating of 3.9. We do not support paid ratings. Our ratings are 100% user-based.

text: DO NOT ORDER WINE THROUGH VIVINO. I ordered $500 worth of wine as a gift and am now deeply embarrassed because it has gone so wrong. The support has been horrendous after their delivery service (not their fault) broke bottles in transit. Some wine had to be refunded because the vendor sold out. Understandable but why would it take 3 weeks to communicate this? Their organization is very compartmentalized and completely offshored. Also keep getting annoying automated duplicate emails (12+)!!

name: Evgeny Zavarygin
text: My friend followed me but I could not see him in my followers list for weeks. Some of my reviews disappear every now and then which is extremely annoying. Upd2: a year after, still quite a dodgy and inconsistent app. Upd3: it's been more than a year since my last upd - my reviews still disappear every now and then. I've never seen such an unreliable app. Shame on you.
vivino_response: Thanks for the feedback. We’re sorry to hear that. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or through our web form: https://www.vivino.com/support, so we can address the issue? We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Nikola Koevski
text: Vivino offers an enormous variety of wine listings. The descriptions of the wines are very detailed, and from what I have found until now, pretty accurate. I have also placed several orders for wines through their online shop, and the packages have always arrived on time and without a scratch on them. Related to orders, an order was canceled due to unavailability. There was a slight misunderstanding with the refund process, but the Customer Support of Vivino was very helpful, patient and efficient with their responses. I have only good things to say about the service.

name: Kyuhwa Lee
text: Very informative and good user base. However, the reviews are often mixed from many different vintages even if I select a specific vintage. Vivino seems to believe that vintage is not an important factor in wine quality but unless there's a consensus of majority about this, it can be only misleading for many wine enthusiasts.

text: This is an amazing app that gives you access to almost every wine in the world and reviews on them. I live to try new wines and have had a few less-than-memorable experiences. Vivino helps take quite a lot of guess work out of this process. How did I live before this...?

name: Jennifer Talackine
text: This app was recommended by a coworker and I haven't been disappointed. My husband and I love to try new wines and this app was exactly what we needed! Need to make sure your picture capture is clean and clear or may have some trouble. Also, as this does often rely on user input, you may find unknown, small vineyards, or obscure off the beaten path wines may not be found on the app. But we love that you can create your own wine profile. Absolutely a must have for new and veteran wine connoisseurs.

text: Really enjoy this app and use it alot. Also get new users on it all the time. Just very frustrating that when I scan a wine it change an old wine to this information. When I change old wine back it changes the new wine also to this info. Happening more and more, aspecially whith wines from one cellar and it's similar looking labels but the name or cultivar is stil different.

name: Henning Marstrand
text: It certainly has a good archive but seems to have a rating purely based on price - if it's expensive it's good and if it's cheap it's no good regardless. Most of the star ratings have no verbal back up. The price ranges don't seem too thorough. I've found lower prices elsewhere fairly easily. It often has missing vintages too so only refers to the vintages it may have listed which could be completely different to the one you want a review on. So really you're best off just googling a wine or looking at winesearcher. Many prices but nowhere recommended to buy them. Really odd that 90% of wines I've checked with it - while here in the heart of Cote du Rhone region for 10 days, in standard super markets and local wine shops - it's given me a cheaper price in the UK....?
vivino_response: Thanks for the feedback! The average prices are based on retail prices, when available. If no retail prices are available, average prices are based on user-inputted data, which is why they might vary. Please feel free to contact us through the app (Contact Vivino) or support@vivino.com and we'll address this issue.

name: Алег Паўленка
text: Well, it's great idea but sometimes it misbehaves. I noticed that it recognized year in wrong way and took three pictures of the same vine. Each time it was regognized differently (had different reviews, stars and comments). My girlfriend took picture two times and got another two different results as well. Once even recognizing white wine as red! If you're not sure about the picture why wouldn't you ask me to retake? If some info required for recongnition is missing from the photo, I'd rather find out and fill it in than see erroneous results. If you can't determine for sure why wouldn't you honestly tell me that and either give multiple results or ask me to wait for 'experts' to match it? Well, why would you give inconsistent results at all, shouldn't similar pictures produces the same result, if angle, lighting and proximity really matters that match than the program is simply unreliable.
vivino_response: Thanks for the feedback. We are sorry to hear that your wine wasn't matched correctly. We are continually working to make sure our data is correct. Would you mind contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or on support@vivino.com, so we can address the issue?

name: Joanna
text: I had a registered account for a year and three months. My phone broke and I bought a new one. When I logged into my account, all my ratings, scans, and friends list were gone. Contacted support with evidence of my previous scans, and they did nothing. I'm too angry to start over. I'm going with another app where the people know what they're doing. I also paid the $4.99/Month. Don't do it. Now the reply person is dishonest. They told me I never had an account or it wasn't registered ' so I sent them a screen shot. Then they asked me to name a wine rated. I did. 2days later ' they asked for the store I bought it from ' I told them with address. Then nothing for 2 days ' then name someone on my friends list. This went on for two weeks. I got tired of chasing my tail, so I gave up. There was no intention of recovering my account. They just kept me busy with silly questions that would not matter. Profiles are created with emails, not the wine you rate.
vivino_response: Hi there. I can see that you have contacted us via support@vivino.com March 2 and was answered March 7. You haven't replied since. Please check your email and see if this message was caught by your spam folder. Please contact us again if you're absolutely sure that you can't find our response to your previous email.

name: Richard Pickett
text: Love it. I like the paring recommendations, and seeing on a scan how "this wine" compares to the others on the same shelf when I'm shopping (at least a consensus opinion). HOWEVER. Not being able to put them in my "cellar" without paying MONTHLY is a little aggressive. I get it, you want to make money. (As if by making a FREE app and making your money by selling wine through it isn't enough monthly already!) I'd rather pay a one-time of even $20 to unlock cellar and get all future updates for free than to shell out the $5/mo you are asking now. And let's consider the economics of my proposal. I'm not paying the monthly, nor will I, because I'm tracking my "cellar" through "Cellar Tracker" FOR FREE. So saving $60 a year is worth tracking them there and relegating your app for wine advice. $20 one-time v.s $0 all the time. The question you have to ask yourself is if you like being in second place with a smaller audience, or if you'd like to dominate first place by unlocking it for free and making your money through wine/related sales. I'm sure you can figure out which one I recommend, and consider that it's not for selfish reasons, but it's the way of the market.
vivino_response: Thanks for the feedback. I have passed your feedback on to the developers. If you have any other feedback we'd love to hear from you again, either contacting us through the app (Contact Vivino) or support@vivino.com.

vivino_response: You will need to unblock Google Play services, as that app requests these permissions and Vivino is built to work with Google Play services. You can see which permissions Vivino requests via Apps -> App info -> Permissions. There you can also enable/disable permissions. If anything is unclear, please contact us on support@vivino.com.

vivino_response: Thanks for the feedback. It sometimes happens that the wine isn't matched correctly. However, when you use 'Edit WIne' - you help us getting better at matching the wine correctly the next time. We are currently experiencing issues with 'Add Place' - but hope to have it fixed soon. If there's anything else, you can contact us on support@vivino.com.

name: J D
text: I'm a wine newbie and was hoping this app would help me choose wine. it only gives personal recommendations if you subscribe.... I've rated 5 different wines , and it gives me people with similar reviews and what they liked,...it does have reviews of wines, and lots of links to wine articles. so far i found 1 wine i liked with this app and 3 that it listed as recommendations that sucked
vivino_response: Hello Jeff - We're sorry to hear that you didn't have success with some of the wines you found. It is almost impossible to like every wine you try. This is why we offer you a Free overview of the wines you've tried so you can see what wines you seem to like the most. If you have suggestions for improvements, please write us at support@vivino.com :)

vivino_response: To search for wines, please follow these instructions: Go to "My Wines". Click to search icon in the top and the search field appears. You are now free to search among your own wines by pressing "My Wines", or the Vivino database, by pressing "All of Vivino". I hope that answers your question. Otherwise, please contact support@vivino.com for more.

name: Adam Grizzle
text: Absurd Pricing Model UI and Technically this is wonderful. The current pricing model is just absurd though. You choose between a minimal free account and the loathesome monthly subscription. Adding insult to injury their pitch for upgrade includes 1) paying them to fix their own app -aka jump to front of line for unreco...
vivino_response: Thank you. Prices are based on user input and prices from online retailers, when available. Since users scan wines in restaurants and shops the average prices can be affected by this. We recommend not to blindly trust the prices as they may be different, also because of inflation and fluctuations. We plan on improving this feature in the future.

name: June Kendrick
text: Lost my wines on update I don't use it regularly, but when I tried just now, it wanted to update. I let it, and it lost all the old wine entries I had. I like the scanning, but wish I could get my old stuff back.
vivino_response: Hello June. Thank you for writing us. I am sure we can find your account. We have handled issues like this many times before with success. Please write us at support@vivino.com with a description of your account - and we should be able to find it. I wish you the best of luck.

name: josh brzoznowski
text: good luck! I work in the alcohol industry and often go to tastings where taking pictures of dozens of bottles and waiting for the app to ID them is impractical, so i take notes and add the entries later at home. BUT, so many don't come up in the search and there is no obvious way to create entries for wines th...
vivino_response: Hello Josh - We're sorry that you don't always get the right wines. Alternatively, you can use your native camera in the app. Go to the scanning screen, but instead of taking a picture, click the gallery icon. Please try and see if that helps :) I was able to recreate the bug and have passed it on to our developers. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Steve Tonkin
text: It's OK, but flawed and, therefore, irritating. The Spanish wine Bitacora Verdejo 2014 is a perfect example of this: * Vivino seems to think that it's made in the Castellana winery in Italy. This is obviously wrong, but there is no immediately obvious way to have this corrected. * Vivino states that it's available in 4 shops but, when I attempt to buy, it only offers me Wijnhuis Oss in Holland, which will only sell to Dutch and Belgian locations. A bit useless when your location is marked as UK! Fix these things, & I'll give it more stars but, at the moment, it's broken.

vivino_response: Hello Yasser - Thank you for the feedback. Please rest assure that we have no intentions to offend anyone. We are a wine app, and we sometimes make changes in areas and other categories only for practical reasons. As this case shows, these changes can be seen differently and we are sorry about that. Forwarded this to our developer team. Thank you.

name: Dean Duckett
text: High price for premium features is prohibitive Very easy to use, great way to identify and log your favourite wines. But £35 a YEAR to keep track of wines I buy? No thanks... subscription model is a rip off in this case. I pay that much for Evernote in which I record my favourite wines and much more!
vivino_response: Hi Dean - Thank you for your feedback. In addition to the My Cellar feature, the Premium subscription offers Fast Track for manual matching of scanned wines, Expert Ratings from leading wine critics and a bi-weekly Personal Buying Guide. If you have any other suggestions for improvements, we're all ears on support@vivino.com. - The Vivino team

name: Steve Weber
text: VivinoFebruary 24, 2016
vivino_response: Hi Steve - Thank you for your feedback! This is definitely something we can improve. You can in fact add your friends wines by selecting it and select Actions and then "Add to My Wines". This could of course be made easier and your suggestion has been forwarded to our development team.

vivino_response: Full Review

name: A Google user
text: So much promise but poor performance Was excited to get home and try out this app, but excitement turned to frustration. Began scanning the bottles at my home. The first one I could not get to focus. I could focus when hitting the button, but the image that resulted was blurry. Tried different distances, high light, flash, florescent, ...
vivino_response: Hi Bob - Please try to update to the latest version in order to fix this issue. Let us know, if you experience any other issue. Cheers!

name: Dustin Jones
text: Camera Loses Focus Incredibly annoying. After trying to take a picture of a label from multiple times with different light sources (natural daylight, incandescent, with cell phone light), it'll initially focus just fine when setting up the shot (either with tapping the screen or letting it autofocus), but upon pressin...
vivino_response: Hi Dustin - Thank you for letting us know about this. We are working on some fixes for the camera on Nexus 5, and hopefully this will be fixed soon. In the mean time, please use the import option, when on the scanner. You can then import a photo from your device or use the native camera app to scan the wine, which then will be uploaded to Vivino.

name: H Kim
text: Frustrating and buggy I initially loved the app so much I paid $50 to become a premium user. Much to my chagrin, one of the prime features of premium is full of bugs. I have added wines to my cellar but they keep disappearing whenever I exit the cellar view. UPDATE : This bug has now been fixed and the cellar works g...
vivino_response: We're sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue. This is certainly not an ideal start for a Premium membership. Our technical team is currently investigating this issue, and we hope to have a fix ready for the next update. Please see our response in our email conversation for more details.

name: Brian Bandsma
text: Used to be good The app is increasing getting cluttered with bad data. People are inputting wines incorrectly and the Vivino staff is unresponsive to requests to correct information.
vivino_response: Hello Brian - Thank you for your feedback. We do look into data-inputs that our users submit, but since we have millions of wines and users it is a long process. We are aware of this and therefore, we are working on a better model for user input. I know this doesn't solve the issue, but at least you have an explanation now.

name: Kevin Lusty
text: During one of the updates I lost access to my "pro" account. It took 2 months before support acknowledged, let alone fixed my problem... Update: after taking a picture, the app freezes (eventually fixed) Update: The database was quite poor at matching the choices, and there was no way to make corrections (eventually fixed) Of the 20 or so photos that I took, every single one of them had (and still has) a problem with the data. Update: Permissions are very excessive. Update: My camera works great in other apps, but when attempting to take pictures with vivino interface it always lags and the resulting picture is blurry and out of focus.
vivino_response: Hi Kevin - Thank you for letting us know about this. We are working on some fixes for the camera on Nexus 5, and hopefully this will be fixed soon. In the mean time, please use the import option, when on the scanner. You can then import a photo from your device or use the native camera app to scan the wine, which then will be uploaded to Vivino.

name: Johnny Quarrie
text: All I wanted was something that kept a record of how I rated different wines. But I also get to see what others think of wines before I buy them on a whim. Making entries by taking a picture of the label is so much easier than typing in a notepad, and I can order them in a variety of ways. Being able to list which local shops have which wines is a bonus too. I can't fault this app.

name: Daniel Wittekind
text: I like that I can see what's good and available in places nearby. However, my phone reports high battery usage for Vivino and it seems to be requesting the location 24/7. Which is unnecessary, wasteful and intrusive. Phone is Z3 Compact.
vivino_response: Hi Daniel - Thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear that. We are currently investigating the issue, and you can expect a fix in an upcoming update. As of now, please "kill" the Vivino app after you've closed it, by swiping it away from the recent list of apps. This should solve the issue. Sorry for the inconvenience.

We look forward to hearing from you.
